required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Probiotic Chewables in Allergic Rhinoconjunctivitis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Probiotic Potential of a Lacticaseibacillus Strain in the Upper Airways in Patients With Allergic Rhinoconjunctivitis After Administration in a Chewable

brief_summary.textblock: With this double- blind, randomised, placebo-controlled study, we want to investigate the influence of a chewable with the probiotic strain Lacticaseibacillus rhamnosus GG on the symptoms and immunological markers of allergic rhinoconjunctivitis (AR). In addition, we aim to investigate the influence of this probiotic chewable on the microbiome of the upper respiratory tract after administration in adults with AR. The bacterial and cytokine profiles in the naso- and oropharynx will be monitored before, during and after the treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Transfer of L. rhamnosus GG to the oronasopharyngeal cavity after administration of the chewable
Changes in the score of allergic rhinitis symptoms
primary_outcome.description: Daily questionnaires will be used, in which a self-reported Total Nasal Symptom Score (TNSS) based on rhinorrhea, nasal congestion, nasal itching and sneezing with symptom severity ranging from 0 to 12 will be recorded.

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in microbiome of the oronasopharyngeal region after administration of the chewable
Inlfuence on general nose- and mouth health
secondary_outcome.description: A clinical evaluation by an ENT specialist will be performed at the start and 8 weeks of the study to assess the general nose and mouth health of the participants. Questions on discomfort and symptoms of inflammation or infection in the nose and mouth will be included in the SNOT-22-based questionnaire implemented at the start, week 8 and week 10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the absolute numbers of specific airway pathogens and viruses
Changes in cytokine levels (e.g. IL-10, IL-4, IL-5, IL-13) in oro- and nasopharynx samples, and cytokine and antibody levels in blood samples

secondary_outcome.description: Daily questionnaires will be used where the type and frequency of medication use should be recorded

arm_group.description: daily use of a probiotic chewable for 8 weeks
daily use of the placebo chewable for 8 weeks

intervention.description: chewables without probiotic strain. Ingredients: Xylitol, microcrystalline cellulose, stearic acid, natural orange flavor, silica, magnesium stearate, citric acid and malic acid.
